summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 13, 2019. It details routine operational activities, inmate counts, and movements throughout three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The logs note the facility's population, security checks, and the presence of inmates on psychological observation, but do not contain specific information related to the Epstein case beyond being a record from the facility where he was held.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, security checks, body alarm tests, inmate movements to/from court, releases from SHU, new commitments, and transfers.

events.title: FBI Delivers New Inmate
events.description: At 11:05 PM during the Evening Watch, the FBI arrived with one new inmate to be committed to the facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This is a routine daily operations log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 13, 2019, the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The log details standard procedures like inmate counts, security checks, and inmate movements, but does not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name.
Several inmates are noted as being on 'psychological observation' with an 'inmate companion', indicating a specific monitoring protocol.
The FBI is recorded as delivering a new inmate to the facility at 11:05 PM.
The document shows the facility was monitoring phone calls for 'STG/High Alert' and 'International Terrorist' concerns, and inquiring about WITSEC (Witness Security).
